item.title: 샘플 페이지
item.dc:creator: enflex_en190328
item.content:encoded:
이것은 예제 페이지입니다. 이것은 한곳을 차지하고 사이트 내비게이션에 표시되기 때문에 블로그 글과는 다릅니다(대부분의 테마). 대다수의 사람들은 잠재적인 사이트 방문자들에게 자신을 소개하기 위한 "사이트 소개" 페이지부터 시작합니다. 다음과 같이 작성할 수 있습니다:
안녕하세요! 저는 낮에는 자전거로 배달하는 일을 하고 밤에는 배우가 되기 위한 연기 연습을 합니다. 여기는 제 웹사이트입니다. 서울에 살고 순돌이라는 이름의 대단한 개가 있으며 피냐 콜라다를 좋아합니다.(비 맞기도 좋아합니다.)
...또는 이럴 수도 있습니다:
가나다 회사는 2012년에 만들어졌으며 그 후로 소비자를 위해 품질 좋은 생산품을 만들고 있습니다. 고양시에 위치하며 2천명의 직원이 있고 고양시 커뮤니티를 위해 다양하고 멋진 일을 하고 있습니다.
새로운 워드프레스 사용자로써, 자신의 관리자 화면으로 가서 이 페이지를 삭제하고 자신의 콘텐츠로 채워진 새로운 페이지를 만들어보세요. 즐기세요!

item.title: 개인정보 처리방침
item.dc:creator: enflex_en190328
item.content:encoded:
회사 소개

우리의 웹사이트 주소: http://en190328.enflex001.gethompy.com.

수집하는 개인 데이터 종류 및 수집 이유

댓글

방문자가 사이트에서 댓글을 남기면 스팸 감지를 위해 댓글 폼에 보여지는 데이터, 방문자의 IP 주소, 브라우저 사용자 에이전트 스트링을 수집합니다.

그라바타를 사용할 경우 이를 감지하기 위해 이메일 주소(해시로도 불려짐)에서 생성된 익명화된 스트링이 그라바타 서비스에 제공됩니다. 그라바타 서비스 개인정보 처리방침은 https://automattic.com/privacy/. 에서 가능합니다. 댓글의 승인 후에 프로필 사진이 댓글에 공개돼 볼 수 있습니다.

미디어

웹사이트에 이미지를 업로드할 경우 임베드 위치 데이터(EXIF GPS)가 있는 이미지 업로드를 피해야 합니다. 웹사이트 방문자는 웹사이트의 이미지로부터 모든 위치 데이터를 다운로드 및 추출이 가능합니다.

컨택트 폼

쿠키

우리 사이트에 댓글을 남기면 이름, 이메일 주소, 웹사이트를 쿠키로 저장할지 결정할 수 있습니다. 이것은 편의를 위한 것으로 다른 댓글을 추가할 때 다시 상세 정보를 입력하지 않아도 되는 것입니다. 이 쿠키는 1년간 지속됩니다.

계정이 있으면서 이 사이트에 로그인하면 브라우저가 쿠키를 수용하는지 여부를 결정하기 위해 임시 쿠키를 설정합니다. 이 쿠키는 아무런 개인적인 데이터를 포함하지 않으며 브라우저를 닫으면 제거됩니다.

로그인하면 로그인 정보와 화면 표시 선택을 저장하기 위해 몇 가지 쿠키를 설정합니다. 로그인 쿠키는 이틀간 지속됩니다. 화면 옵션 쿠키는 1년간 지속됩니다. "기억하기"를 선택하면 로그인은 2주 지속됩니다. 계정을 로그아웃하면 로그인 쿠키는 제거됩니다.

글을 편집하거나 발행하면 추가적인 쿠키가 자신의 웹브라우저에 저장됩니다. 이 쿠키는 비개인적인 데이터를 포함하며 단순히 편집한 글 ID를 지시합니다. 1일 후에 만료됩니다.

다른 웹사이트로부터 임베드된 콘텐츠

이 사이트의 글은 임베드된 콘텐츠(예: 비디오, 이미지, 기사 등)가 포함될 수도 있습니다. 다른 웹사이트로부터 임베드된 콘텐츠는 방문자가 해당 다른 웹사이트를 방문한 것과 동일하게 작동됩니다.

이들 웹사이트는 개인 데이터를 수집하거나 쿠키를 사용하거나 추가적인 제 3자 트래킹을 임베드 하거나 해당 임베드된 콘텐츠와 상호작용을 모니터 할 수도 있습니다. 여기에는 계정을 가지고 해당 웹사이트에 로그인했을 경우 임베드된 콘텐츠와 상호작용하는 추적이 포함됩니다.

분석

데이터를 공유하는 자

데이터를 보존하는 기간

댓글을 남길 경우 댓글과 해당 메타데이터는 영구히 보존됩니다. 이것은 댓글에 관련 댓글이 있을 경우 검토중으로 있는 것을 방지하기 위해 인지하고 자동으로 승인하기 위해서 입니다.

우리의 웹사이트에 회원가입한 사용자에 대해서 우리는 회원이 자신의 프로필에 제공한 개인정보를 저장합니다. 모든 사용자는 자신의 개인 정보를 언제든(회원이 자신의 사용자명을 변경할 수 없을 때는 제외) 열람하거나 편집, 또는 삭제할 수 있습니다. 웹사이트 관리자도 해당 정보를 보거나 편집할 수 있습니다.

데이터에 관해 갖는 권리의 종류

이 사이트에 계정을 갖고 있거나 댓글을 남길 경우 우리가 가지고 있는 개인 데이터의 내보내기 파일을 요청할 수 있습니다. 여기에는 우리에게 제공한 모든 데이터를 포함합니다. 또한 우리가 가지고 있는 모든 개인 데이터를 제거하도록 요청할 수도 있습니다. 여기에는 관리용, 법률적인 또는 보안 목적으로 보존할 의무가 있는 데이터는 포함하지 않습니다.

데이터를 보내는 장소

방문자 댓글은 자동화된 스팸 감지 서비스를 통해 점검될 수도 있습니다.

연락 정보

추가 정보

데이터를 보호하는 방법

데이터 위반 과정 종류

데이터를 수집하는 제 3자의 종류

사용자 데이터를 통해 작업하는 자동화된 의사결정 그리고/또는 프로파일링 종류

산업 규제 표시 권장사항

item.title: Popcorn——Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: enflex_en180411
item.content:encoded:
[mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider size="140"][vc_column_text align="center" css=".vc_custom_1553480734038{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

Privacy Policy

[/vc_column_text][mk_divider style="thin_solid" divider_width="custom_width" custom_width="40" thin_single_color="#000000" thickness="4"][mk_padding_divider size="30"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553154560850{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

PopcornSAR. (the "Company") has abided by regulations for telecommunications providers related to protection of personal information, such as Act on Promotion of Information and Communications Network Utilization and Information Protection, Personal Information Protection Act, Protection of Communications Secrets Act, and Telecommunications Business Act, so as to make the best efforts in protecting user's rights by specifying privacy policy in accordance with relevant regulations.

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="25"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553111422214{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

Privacy Policy of PopcornSAR Service includes the following:

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1553111026026{background-color: #f2f2f2 !important;}"][vc_column_inner css=".vc_custom_1553111134915{padding-top: 30px !important;padding-right: 30px !important;padding-bottom: 30px !important;padding-left: 30px !important;background-color: #f2f2f2 !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553111042849{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

1. Collecting Personal Information
2. Purpose of Collecting and Using Personal Information
3. Sharing Personal Information
4. Assignment of Personal Information
5. Retention and Usage Period of Personal Information
6. Procedure and Method of Disposal of Personal Information
7. Rights of Users and Legal Representatives and How to Exercise
8. Installation/Operation and Rejection of Automatic Collecting Device of Personal Information
9. Customized Online Ads
10. Technical/Administrative Protection of Personal Information
11. Contact of Chief Privacy Officer
12. Others
13. Obligation of Notification

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553111413749{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

1. Collecting Personal Information

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553111665536{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

A. Collecting Personal Information
Personal information shall be collected as follows, in the process of member subscription:
- Information: (Required) ID (email address), Password, Mobile Phone Number
Personal information shall be collected as follows, to respond to customers related to service inquiries:
- (Required) Email Address, Mobile Phone Number, Inquiries/ (Optional) Attached Files
Personal information shall be collected as follows, to register payment methods:
- For Credit Cards: Name of Card Company, Part of Card Numbers
Information as below may be created and collected, in the process of service use:
- IP Address, Cookies, Visit Date/Time, Service Use History, Record of Unjust Service Use, Device Information (e.g. Unique device identifier, device setting, Ad-ID, and basic statistical data for service use), History of installation and Use of Applications on Mobile Devices, and Record of Payment/Purchase
With user's consent, following information may be collected, depending on the service: .
- When user agrees to collect additional personal information.

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="30"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553111681963{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

B. Methods of Collecting Personal Information
The Company shall collect personal information in the following methods:
- On website or mobile devices, in a written format, by phone, email
- Via collecting tool of created information

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="2" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553112140350{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

2. Purpose of Collecting and Using Personal Information

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553112179321{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

The Company shall use collected personal information for the following purposes:
- To provide services as promised; verify user identity; purchase and pay prices; deliver transaction statements; and deliver products and services.
- To manage members: confirm intent of subscription, identify users, and confirm intent of withdrawal, process inquiries or complaints.
- To protect users and operate services; restrict service use of the members who violate relevant laws and Terms of Services; prevent and sanction activities that block flawless service operations, including unjust uses and unauthorized activities; prevent theft of account and illegal transaction; deliver notification; and, to retain records for the mediation of conflicts.
- To provide services based on features of demographic statistics, analyze frequency of access, improve functions, draw statistics on the service use, and to provide new services (including recommendations for customized products) by reflecting user's tendency for product purchase and service use, interest, and analysis on use records on the back of service analysis and statistics.
- Also to provide information on events or advertisement, as part of event and promotional purposes.

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="3" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553144003955{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

3. Sharing Personal Information

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553144069721{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

The Company shall use personal information of its users as specified in "2. Purpose of Collecting and Using Personal Information" and shall not use it without user's prior consent or not share it on principle. Nevertheless, exceptions shall be applied for the following cases:
- With user's prior consent
- When it is required to pay for services
- When it is demanded by an investigative agency according to the procedure and method set by law, for investigation

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="4" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553144137630{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

4. Retention and Usage Period of Personal Information

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553144152560{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

The Company, on principle, shall retain user's personal information until user's withdrawal. Following information shall be retained during specified periods due to following reasons, even after member withdraws.

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="20"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553144254719{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

A. Cause of Retention due to Corporate Policy
- Record of Unjust Use
Cause of Retention: Prevent unjust uses and respond to customers
Retention Period: 1 year after collected date

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="30"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553144279004{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

B. Cause of Retention in Accordance with Relevant Acts
The Company shall retain user's information, if required, during specific periods set by relevant acts, in accordance with regulations, including Act on Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, etc. In this case, the Company shall use such information for the sole purpose of retention during the following periods:
- Log Records on Service Use
Cause of Retention: Protection of Communications Secrets Act
Retention Period: 3 Months
- Records on Handling Consumer Complaints or Conflicts
Cause of Retention: Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, Etc.
Retention Period: 3 Years
- Records on Cancellation of Contracts and Subscriptions
Cause of Retention: Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, Etc.
Retention Period: 5 Years
- Records on Payment and Supply of Products
Cause of Retention: Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, Etc.
Retention Period: 5 Years
- Records of Tax Invoice Issuance for Service Users
Cause of Retention: National Tax Service Notice 2016-3
Retention Period: 3 Years

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="5" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553153525409{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

5. Procedure and Method of Disposal of Personal Information

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553153536536{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

Personal information, on principle, shall be immediately disposed once the purpose of its collection and use is attained. Nevertheless, the Company shall dispose of or separately save personal information of the members who have no records of service use for a year, according to 'Valid Period of Personal Information'. The procedure and method of disposal are as follows:

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553153559720{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

A. Procedure of Disposal
User information entered for subscription shall be relocated to a separate database (a separate document container, for papers), after the purpose is attained, to be saved for certain periods in terms of protection of information (see Retention and Usage Period), according to internal policy and relevant acts. Such personal information shall not be used for other purposes than retention due to regulations.

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="30"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553153588782{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

B. Method of Disposal
Personal information printed on papers shall be shredded or burned.
Its electronic versions shall be deleted by technological methods to prevent playing records.

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="6" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553153766848{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

6. Installation/Operation and Rejection of Automatic Collecting Device of Personal Information

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553153798889{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

A. What is a Cookie?
The Company makes use of "cookies" to save and import user information any time, so as to provide personalized and customized services. Cookies refer to very small text files sent by a server used to operate a website, to a user's browser, and they are saved in a hard drive on user's computer.

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="30"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553153814987{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

B. Purpose of Us
Cookies are applied to analyze each service of a company, used by a user, as well as the use type, and to provide the user with the most customized information.

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="30"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553154688724{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

C.Installation/Operation or Rejection of Cookies
A user has an option to install cookies or not. With the option setting on a web browser, cookies may be allowed or rejected for saving at all times, or confirmed every time to be saved.
Nevertheless, the rejection of cookie saving may cause difficulties in using some services requiring logins

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553219468079{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

How to Enable Cookie Installation
- For Internet Explorer
Go to [Tools] > [Internet Option] > [Personal Information] > Change [Settings]
- For Chrome
Go to Menu on the top right [Settings] > [Advanced] > [Content Setting] > Enable [Cookies]

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="30"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553154780882{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

D. Installation/Operation of Cookies for Mobile Services
The Company may use "cookies" on mobile devices (e.g. smart phones, or tablet pc) to provide same or similar internet environments as pc. However, the Company shall not randomly collect cookies of the 3rd parties, including personal information, without user's explicit consent. You can still choose to allow cookies on mobile devices with the setting of a web browser. In most cases, cookies could be chosen to activate in Settings of a mobile web browser or deleted as a whole, although it may differ from operating systems or web browsers of each device. In any case, when cookies are rejected from saving, service use may be restricted when login is required

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553219482850{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

How to Enable Cookie Installation
- For Chrome
Go to Menu on the top right [Settings] > [Site Setting] > Enable [Cookies]
- For Safari
[Settings] > [Safari] > [Block Cookies] > Settings

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="7" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553153916867{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

7. Customized Online Ads

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553153944674{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

The Company allows the advertisers as below, to collect online user's activities through an analysis tool for information created within company services and use them to deliver customized ad services.
- Google

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="8" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553153980733{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

8. Technical/Administrative Protection of Personal Information

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553154013805{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

The Company is coming up with technological/administrative means to secure safety in processing personal information so that it shall not be lost, stolen, leaked, or damaged.

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553154034163{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

A. Encryption of Passwords
Password of member ID shall be encrypted for saving and management, hence kept to the owner only, and its confirmation and change shall also be made available only by the owner.

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="30"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553154050625{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

B. Measures against Hackings
The Company is striving hard not to cause member's personal information to be leaked or damaged by hackings or computer viruses. To prepare against damage of personal information, data backup is randomly executed while the most updated vaccine program is applied not to leak or damage user's personal information or data; encrypted communication is used to safely transmit personal information through networks. In addition, unauthorized access from outside is controlled by intrusion blockage system, while all possible technological means are to be equipped to attain security systematically.

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="30"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553154077790{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

C. Minimization and Training of Personnel
Privacy policy shall be dealt with by restricted number of personnel with password provided for the sole purpose, while training is provided at all times to emphasize the obedience of privacy policy.

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="30"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553154099485{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

D. Operation of Specialized Privacy Team
The Company is running a specialized privacy team to track execution of Privacy Policy and obedience by privacy managers so as to immediately correct any problems or wrongdoings.
However, the Company shall not take any responsibilities whatsoever for any issues arising out of exposure of personal information, such as ID or password, due to user's negligence or internet errors.

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="9" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553154215424{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

9. Contact of Chief Privacy Officer

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553154226423{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

The Company has specified a representative for the protection of personal information who collects opinions and handles complaints related to personal information. You may contact our Chief Privacy Officer to report all issues related to personal information which may arise while using the service. The Company shall respond with speed and sufficient feedbacks to your needs.

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553154322291{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

- Chief Privacy Officer

[/vc_column_text][vc_row_inner css=".vc_custom_1553111026026{background-color: #f2f2f2 !important;}"][vc_column_inner css=".vc_custom_1553154350913{padding: 10px !important;background-color: #f2f2f2 !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553154332875{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

Name: Hyunhee Dang
Team/Position: Manager/ Strategy Planning Marketing Team
Email: hhdang@popcornsar.com,
Phone Number: +82-2-568-3068
To report or ask for consultation on intrusion of personal information, contact the following institutions:

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553219605010{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

- Privacy Intrusion Report Center of Korea Internet & Security Agency (http://privacy.kisa.or.kr, or118)
- Cyber Investigation Team, of Supreme Prosecutor's Office (http://www.spo.go.kr, or 1301)
- National Policy Agency, Cyber Bureau (http://cyberbureau.police.go.kr, or 182)

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="10" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553154388714{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

10. Others

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553154399789{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

Please be informed that this Privacy Policy shall not be applied to the web pages which are linked to services provided by the Company, for their collection of personal information.

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="11" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553154423672{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

11. Obligation of Notification

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553154434736{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

In case the current version of Privacy Policy needs to be added, deleted, or modified, it shall be notified via "Notification" on the website at least 7 days before revision. However, if there is any significant change in user's rights, it shall be notified at least 30 days before.

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553154492488{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

Version : v1.0
Notified Date : April 1 of 2019
Effective Date : April 1 of 2019

[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" visibility="hidden-sm" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1532016701430{padding-left: 100px !important;}"][mk_padding_divider size="70"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section]

item.title: Popcorn——Terms of use
item.dc:creator: enflex_en180411
item.content:encoded:
[mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider size="140"][vc_column_text align="center" css=".vc_custom_1553480701890{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Terms of use
[/vc_column_text][mk_divider style="thin_solid" divider_width="custom_width" custom_width="40" thin_single_color="#000000" thickness="4"][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553162232765{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Chapter 1. General Terms
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553162157085{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 1. Purpose
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553162170766{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
The purpose of these Terms of Services (the "Terms") lies in specifying rights, obligations and reliabilities, and etc. of PopcornSAR Co., Ltd. (the "Company") and members (the "Member"), in relation of the use of AutoSAR.io services and relevant infrastructure services (collectively, the "Service") provided by the Company.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553162284733{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 2. Definitions
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553164264388{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. Terms are defined as follows:
  •  "Service" refers to AutoSAR.web.io Service for cloud-based IT resources and platforms that the Company provides to users, and relevant backbone services, including technical support for the use of AutoSAR.web.io Service.
  • "Member" refers to an individual or a corporate entity entitled to use the Service by the Company, by entering a Service Agreement with the Company.
  • "Internal Member" refers to an individual to whom the Member grants the right to use the Service in accordance with the terms of Service usage which is pre-defined by the Company.
  • "ID" refers to an electronic address set by the Member for the identification of the Member and use of the Service.
  • "Password" refers to the combination of characters and numbers set by the Member, to protect confidentiality of the Member.
  • "Payment Responsible Holder" refers to a person who is responsible for paying prices of the Service provided by the Terms.
  • "Post" refers to information posted by the Member in the Services, including characters, documents, photos, audio, video, or the combination of them.
  • "Agreed Territory" refers to the Republic of Korea. The Company and the Member may expand the Agreed Territory under mutual consent in a separate agreement.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553162535981{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
2. Any other terms that are used in the Terms but not defined in this Article shall abide by user's guide of the Service, operating policies and relevant rules, or customs
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553162569800{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 3. Posting and Amendment of the Terms
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553162593201{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. The Terms of Services shall be posted on the Service page or notified to the Member in other means. 2. The Company may revise the Terms as long as they don't violate acts of the Republic of Korea, such as Act on the Regulation of Terms and Conditions, Act on Promotion of Information and Communications Network Utilization and Information Protection, and Act on the Development of Cloud Computing and Protection of Its Users. 3. In case the Company wants to revise the Terms, expected date of application and reasons for revision must be announced on the startup page of the Service, along with the current Terms of Services, from 7 days before expected date of application. However, if revisions may be disadvantageous to the Member, or major changes are expected, such announcement shall be made at least 30 days in advance, with additional notices delivered to the existing Member via electronic means, like email. 4. Even after the Company announced or notified that a failure of refusal by the Member before date of application for changed Terms of Services is deemed as consent to change of the Terms of Services, and if the Member has not expressed any refusal for the change of the Terms until an effective date, it is deemed that the Member has consented to change of the Terms. 5. Consent to the Terms means that the Member agrees to visit the Service regularly and check changes of the Terms of Services. The Company shall not be eligible for any damage incurred to the Member for not being informed on changed Terms of Services.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553162640230{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 4. Other Terms and Regulations
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553162651282{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. The Company can have individual Terms of Services and Operating Policy (the "Individual Terms of Services") for each Service, and if conflicts occur between the two, individual Terms of Services shall take precedence. 2. Any other clauses not specified in the Terms shall abide by individual Terms of Services and regulations set by relevant acts, including Act on the Development of Cloud Computing and Protection of Its Users, Framework Act on Telecommunications, Telecommunications Business Act, Monopoly Regulation and Fair Trade Act, Act on Promotion of Information and Communications Network Utilization and Information Protection, and Act on the Consumer Protection in Electronic Commerce, Etc. 3. In relation of the Terms, announcement by the Company for the change of operating policy, enactment/amendment of acts, or notification or guidelines of public institutions, on bulletin of the corporate website shall also comprise a part of the Service Agreement.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553162677168{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Chapter 2. Conclusion of Service Agreement
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553162689317{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 5. Application of Service and the Method
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553162794044{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. The "Service Agreement" shall be entered, when a potential Member (the "Service Applicant") applies for the Service according to the application procedure as the Company provides, which then will be permitted by the Company. 2. The Service Applicant must supply basic information (including email address and phone number) that the Company demands. 3. For a business Member, additional documents, as follows, must be submitted in person, by fax or postal delivery, or any other means permitted by the Company, before the 15th day of the following month after subscribed to the Service:
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553162885477{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
  •  Application Form of the Service (if necessary, as specified by the Company)
  •  Business Registration Certificate of the Payment Responsible Holder
  •  Other documents deemed necessary by the Company for price exemption or discounts
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553162772925{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
4. The Company may ask the Service Applicant to go through an authentication procedure to confirm identity. In such case, the Service Applicant must complete the procedure by performing authentication.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553162969412{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 6. Permits and Restrictions of Service Application
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553163832390{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. The Company is reserving the right to deny acceptance to an application submitted by a Service Applicant, if the application falls under any one of the following subparagraphs:
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553163911363{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
  • The application has been made in a false name or in the name of others, without their consent;
  • Information of the Member is false;
  • There is a concern for damaging acts, public order, or customs;
  • There is an attempt to use the Service for unjust purposes;
  • There is an attempt to use the Service for the purpose of personal benefits, without prior consent of the Company;
  • Permit is unavailable due to reasons attributable to the Service Applicant, or when service has been applied in violation of other regulated conditions;
  • Prices for other services of the Company are in arrears;
  • Records exist for late payment or improper service use of the past;
  • The Service Applicant does not meet the qualification standards, and thus ineligible, for using the Service under the Terms; and,
  • Other reasons comparable with any of the above subparagraphs, for which the Company finds the issuance of permits to be quite inappropriate.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553477476718{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
2. The Company is entitled to withhold permitting application of the Service Applicant, if it falls under one any of the following subparagraphs:
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553477515661{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
  • Service is interrupted in facilities due to natural disasters;
  • The overall service quality of the Company is deemed difficult to maintain with the Service provided;
  • Facilities for the Service are insufficient, or the Service cannot be provided due to technical reasons;
  • Threats or potential threats exist for operations or business of the Company;
  • The Member has failed to register caller identification number to prove his identity in advance;
  • Other reasons comparable with any of the above subparagraphs, for which the Company cannot readily permit.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553477533803{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
3. The Company, on principle, shall notify the Service Applicant of refusal or reserves of permits for application.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553477623364{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 7. Provision and Change of Member Information
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553477639379{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. The Member shall be obliged to provide honest and legal information when required to provide his own identity to the Company, in accordance with the Terms, and cannot be protected against any disadvantages that may result by providing false or illegal information. 2. The Member can browse and modify his own information at any time, on the management page provided by the Service. 3. When there is a change of information in application, the Member shall be obliged to modify it online, or notify in the format or method set by the Company. 4. The Company shall not be responsible for any disadvantages incurred to the Member, due to his failure of notifying changes.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553477679217{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 8. Protection and Management of Personal Information
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553477693817{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. The Company shall make efforts to protect personal information of the Member, in accordance with provisions set by relevant acts. Regarding the protection and use of personal information of the Member, relevant acts, as well as personal information handling policy of the Company, shall apply. 2. The Member is a responsible holder for the management of personal information of the Internal Member, according to relevant acts, and must abide by relevant acts for personal information of the Internal Member. 3. Regarding 3rd party Service, which excludes individual services as part of the Service but simply provides links on the homepage and each service website, personal information handling policy of the Company shall not apply 4. The Company shall not be held responsible for all information whatsoever, including ID and Password of the Member that are exposed due to reasons attributable to the Member. 5. If there is an objective concern for an abuse of account information, or if the Member fails to sign in for a continuous period of one year or more, the Company can take temporary or necessary actions, including suspension of service use, or deletion of account information, for the protection of Member information and operational efficiency.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553477722958{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Chapter 3. Use of Service Offerings
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553477730818{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 9. Provision and Suspension of Service
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553477773056{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. The Company shall provide the Service to the Member from the moment when application of the Member is permitted. However, some services shall be provided from a specific point of time. 2. The Service shall be comprised of individual services for each product type, and the Member can select each individual service with the consent of the Company. 3. The Company may separate the Service by certain range and specify available time of service for each range. However, this shall be notified in advance. 4. The Company may classify the Member, according to the policy of the Company, so as to divide the Service menu and provide different services by usage hour or number of uses. 5. In case of any one of the following subparagraphs, the Service may not be offered, and the Company shall not be obliged to provide the Service:
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553477809608{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
  • Information communication facilities, including computers, require maintenance or replacement, or interruption or disconnection in communication occurs;
  • Facility maintenance for the Service is inevitable;
  • Upgrade or maintenance of the Service is required;
  • Blackout, faulty facilities or congestion block normal Service offerings;
  • Significant administrative needs of the Company arise, such as splits, merges, transfer or closure of operations, as well as revenue worsening of its Service;
  • Out of force majeure, including natural disasters
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553477852230{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
6. Any other reasons comparable with any of the above subparagraphs 7. In the case of paragraph 5, the Company shall notify the Member of the facts in advance, in methods specified in Article 25. However, when in-advance notification is unavailable due to inevitable cases, such as unintentional or unfaulty hackings, notification may be provided after the fact. 8. The Company may use such information (such as advertisement ID and app lists, which are not personal) that is saved while the Service is provided, for the marketing purposes, other than service offering.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="30"][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478014272{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 10. Change and Revision of Service
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478027360{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. Depending on the operational, administrative, or technical needs, the Company may change all or parts of the Service or close it, and if there is a change in the content or method of use, such change shall be notified 7 days before, along with reasons and content of changes and application date; for the closure of the Service, notify it 14 days before, on the startup page of the Service. However, when prior notification is unavailable due to inevitable cases, notification may be provided immediately after the fact. 2. The Company, unless particularly specified in the Terms and relevant acts, shall not be eligible for any damage incurred to the Member due to change or modification of the Service.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478070071{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 11. Service Products
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478083723{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. The Company may provide the Service available to the Member for a given period of time, without additional prices (the "Free Service") and the Service available upon prices as set by the Company (the "Paid Service"). 2. Payment for the Service shall follow a pre-defined method of the Company. 3. Regarding the Paid Service in paragraph 1 of this Article, the Member shall choose and apply for the Paid Service, in compliance of the following:
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478102000{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
  • Applicants for the Paid Service shall pay charges for the Service in due diligence.
  • Applicants for the Paid Service shall pay charges for the Service, using the method the Company provides.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478120194{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 12. Provision of Information and Ad Posting
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478138242{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. The Company may provide the Member with transaction-related information deemed necessary for the use of the Service, and responses to inquiries, in the means of public notes, email, or SMS. Nevertheless, the Member can reject receiving such information through email, at any time. 2. The Company may provide advertisement to the Member through legal procedures, in accordance with relevant acts.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478160421{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 13. Post Management
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478173574{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. In case a post of the Member includes content violating relevant acts, such as Act on Promotion of Information and Communications Network Utilization and Information Protection, and the Copyright Act, the right holder can request for suspension and deletion of such post, while the Company must take actions following relevant regulations. 2. The Company may take temporary actions for posts, containing reasons which could be recognized for violation of rights, or violating policy of the Company and relevant acts, even without rights holders' requests specified in the previous paragraph. 3. Detailed procedures in this Article shall be in compliance with Act on Promotion of Information and Communications Network Utilization and Information Protection, and regulations set by the Copyright Act.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478257137{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Chapter 4. Pricing and Management of Paid Service
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478266220{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 14. Pricing for Paid Service
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478276969{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Price details and relevant services of the "Paid Service" shall follow additional operating policies, and the Company shall notify them on the service website.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478297088{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 15 Method of Price Estimation and Calculation
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478305915{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. Price estimation for the Paid Service shall start from the moment the Paid Service begins to be provided to the Member by the Company. 2. In case the Member pays certain amount in proportion of usage period (the "Fixed Amount Payment"), or the Member cancels service in the middle, prices shall be charged by accumulated number of days of the Service, until it is terminated.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478319135{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 16. Service Charges
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478329158{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. The Company may charge multiple prices (including multiple unpaid prices) on a single bill, if the Member uses a multiple number of services. 2. The Member shall pay service usage fees for the Service with the payment methods specified by the Company. 3. In case charges of the Paid Service remain unpaid for more than 7 days, the Company shall be eligible to suspend the Paid Service which the Member uses, without prior notification; if they remain unpaid for more than a month, the Company may terminate services in accordance with the procedure and method already posted on the website and shall not be accountable for any damage that may be incurred to the Member.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478347167{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 19. Excessive or Wrong Charges
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478356966{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
When the Member paid for excessive or wrong charges, the Company shall refund such charges to the Member.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478396375{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Chapter 5. Obligations
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478404798{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 21. Company’s Obligation
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478416930{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. The Company shall not act in prohibition of the Terms or in violation of common customs, and make the best efforts to provide ongoing and stable Service. 2. The Company shall supply security system to protect personal information to help the Member to safely use the Service, and notify and abide by the personal information handling policy. 3. The Company, when ideas or complaints, suggested by the Member in relation to the use of the Service, are acknowledged to be just, must deal with them: deliver the procedure and result of resolution of such ideas or complaints suggested by the Member, via the Service or email, to the Member. 4. The Company shall abide by regulations relevant to operations and maintenance of the Service, including Act on the Development of Cloud Computing and Protection of Its Users, Act on Promotion of Information and Communications Network Utilization and Information Protection, Protection of Communications Secrets Act, and Telecommunications Business Act.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478466217{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 22. Member’s Obligation
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478475123{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. The Member shall not be allowed to do the following:
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478518015{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
  • Post false information for application or change of it;
  • Steal information from others;
  • Impersonate an employee, operator, or other relevant personnel of the Company;
  • Change information posted by the Company;
  • Transfer or post information prohibited by the Company (like computer programs);
  • Create, distribute, use, or advertise computer programs, devices or appliances that are not provided or authorized by the Company;
  • Infringe on intellectual rights of the Company and any other third party;
  • Damage honor or obstruct business of the Company and any other third parties;
  • Delete or slander banner ads provided by the Company, or other obstructive acts on banner ads;
  • Expose or post obscene or violent words, prints, video, audio, or other information against public order and good morals;
  • Apply the Service as part of personal benefits, sales, advertisements, or political activities, without consent of the Company;
  • Transfer a large amount of information that might damage stable operations of the Service, and transfer or mediate ad information;
  • Distribute computer virus programs that might cause error in operations of computer or information devices;
  • Other activities prohibited in relevant acts or not allowed in the perspectives of decent social customs.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478531497{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
2. The Member, when using the Service offered by the Company, shall be obliged to respect relevant acts, regulations of the Terms, cautions noted on Guides and posted on the Service, and notices of the Company. 3. The Member is obligated to manage and supervise service use activities of all Internal Members who are authorized by him to use the Service, and takes the full responsibility for illegal acts or violation of these Terms of Services by the Internal Member. 4. The Member shall provide an available email address while joining so as to be notified of necessary information related to the Service by the Company, and shall immediately notify the Company of any change of his/her information, and the Company shall not be held liable for any damage incurred to the Member due to his failure to notify changed information to the Company. 5. The Member must randomly check basic policy or regulations, including content of the Terms, initial screen of the Service or notification and individual terms of services set by the Company. 6. The Member shall be obliged to back up and retain his/her own data, and any damage due to his own failure of managing data shall be borne by himself/herself.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478557086{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 23. Member’s Obligation and Responsibility for ID and PW Management
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478576568{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. The Member should be absolutely cautious for his ID and Password not to be exposed or used by a third party. 2. The Member shall be held liable for any damage on the use of the Service due to his violation of the preceding paragraph, or for all consequences from illegal use by a third party, while the Company shall not take responsibilities. 3. The Company may restrict the use of an ID, if it might expose personal information or is against social norms or customs, or if it may be misunderstood as the Company or an operator of the Company. 4. The Member, when acknowledging his ID and Password are misused or abused by a third party, should notify the Company and follow guides of the Company. 5. In the case of the preceding paragraph, the Company shall not be held liable for any disadvantage that may be incurred as the Member failed to notify the fact or failed to follow guides of the Company even after notification was sent.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478596602{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 24. Notice for Member
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478608675{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. A notice to the Member by the Company, unless otherwise specified, shall be sent to the email address or digital memo specified by the Member. 2. When a notice for all Members is required, the Company shall post a notice on the bulletin of the Service for more than 10 days, in place of the preceding paragraph.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478621993{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 25. Assignment of Personal Information
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478634880{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
On principle, the Company shall handle and manage collected personal information on its own, but if necessary, may assign a part or all of its works to a third party selected by the Company. For the assignment of personal information of the Member, personal information handling policy of the Company shall apply.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478647382{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 26. Prohibition of Assignment
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478660077{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. The Member shall not assign, give, or provide as security of the usage authority of the Service or other license agreement positions. 2. In case reasons of inheritance, merger, or split occur to the Member and a third party (the "Assignee") inherits the legal position due to Service Agreement entered between the Member and the Company, the Member and the Assignee shall notify the Company in accordance with the method and procedure specified by the Company, with documents attached proving inheritance. 3. When information of the Member changes due to legal inheritance as in the preceding paragraph, the Assignee must sufficiently understand the management and responsibilities of the remaining contract period, as well as the content, before inheritance. Any related issues that may occur shall be held liable by the Member and the Assignee.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478699910{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Chapter 6. Suspension and Termination of Service
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478709555{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 27. Termination by Member
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478720405{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. The Member may terminate Service Agreement through the Service or Customer Center anytime. 2. When the Service Agreement is terminated, the Member should back up all corresponding resources used throughout the service period. 3. In accordance with paragraph 1 of this Article, when the Member wants to terminate the agreement of the Service, except when the Company retains Member information due to relevant acts and personal information handling policy, all resources provided to the Member shall be returned, and all Posts, information and data saved in the Service shall be deleted. Data, once deleted, cannot be recovered on whatever counts.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478759791{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 28. Suspension of Service
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478768764{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. The Company, when the Member's service use falls under any one of the following subparagraphs, can suspend the Service of the Member, without prior notice:
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478787077{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
  • ① Prices are left unpaid by the last day of the month; ② Obligations of the Member specified in Article 22 of the Terms are violated; ③ Normal service operations by the Company are prohibited; ④ Relevant acts are violated, like theft of identity and credit card data, providing illegal programs in violation of copyright acts and prohibition of operations, illegal communication and hackings violating Act on Promotion of Information and Communications Network Utilization and Information Protection, distribution of malicious programs, or access exceeding authority. ⑤ Any other cases comparable with any of the above subparagraphs which require suspension of the services.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478806261{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
2. In case the Company suspends the service use of the Member in accordance with paragraph 1 of this Article, the Member cannot claim for damages to the Company. 3. In case the Company suspends the service use of the Member in accordance with paragraph 1 of this Article, the Member should be notified of the reason, period of suspension, and method of filing objections, via mail, email or any other equivalent methods. 4. The Company, when it decides that attributable reasons related to paragraph 1 have been resolved, shall promptly release suspension. 5. The Company, if reasons for suspension related to paragraph 1 continue to linger after suspension is applied, may terminate the Service Agreement. In this case, the Company shall notify the Member of the fact, in writing, email or any other equivalent means. 6. The Company may bill charges incurred during suspension period of the Service, in accordance with this Article, to the Member. 7. When the Company, in accordance with paragraph 5 of this Article, terminates the agreement with the Member, the Company can reclaim (including deleting the post, information, and data) systems (including solutions) assigned to the Member. It shall take place after three days after the agreement is terminated, without additional notice; the Member cannot claim for any damages for losses that may be incurred to the Member, such as deletion of documents, to the Company. The Member, when notified of termination of the agreement, must take preceding actions (like backup of documents) before system is returned, to prevent from potential losses.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478825861{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 29. Service Restriction as Part of Provisional Measures
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478834749{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. The Company may take restriction of service, until investigation is completed on problems of each of the following subparagraphs:
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478859887{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
  • When justified reports on hacking or abuses of ID, password, or payment methods are received;
  • When justified reports on hacking or abuses of Appkey, Pem Key are received;
  • When there are reasonable doubts of unlawful activities, such as use of illegal programs;
  • Other cases equivalent to the paragraphs above, for which service restriction is required;
  • When obligations in accordance with Article 22-3 of the Telecommunications Business Act (Technical Measures, etc. of Special Value-Added Telecommunications Business Operations) and Article 84-2 (Prohibition against Using False Phone Numbers and Protection of Users) are violated.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478874910{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
2. During investigation period regarding the previous paragraph, the Company shall not charge the Member for additional costs.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478906921{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 30. Procedure of Filing Objection against Service Suspension
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478917886{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. When the Member objects to service suspension and restriction by the Company, the Member must submit a written objection which contains reasons of objection to the Company, in person, via email, or any other equivalent means. 2. The Company, when receiving an objection in paragraph 1 of this Article, shall respond to reasons of objection of the Member in writing, via email, or any other equivalent means, within a reasonable period. However, if a long-term period is required to deal with the issue, the Company shall send a notice or notify reasons and schedule to the Service. 3. The Company must take measures in corresponding to the responses above.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478959361{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 31. Termination of Service Agreement at Company’s Discretion
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553478968552{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. The Company, if the Service use of a Member is pertaining to the use under one of the following subparagraphs, may terminate the Service Agreement on its discretion, without additional consultation with the Member:
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553479016308{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
  • Content of service application is found to be false;
  • Service operations are prohibited with intention, causing damage to the Company;
  • Obligations of the Member specified in Article 23 are violated;
  • Appropriate measures are not taken for the request of correction as specified in Article 29;
  • The purpose and method of service use are in violation of the Korean law and international laws, so as government agencies require suspension of service offerings through the legal procedure;
  • The Member abuses the service or operating system and performs unnecessary activities so as to damage or attempt to damage corporate services or other customer's system;
  • The Member abuses the service to attack network of large scale targeting at operating systems, causing damage to service operations of the Company and other customer's system; and,
  • Any of the grounds for rejection of Service Application under each subparagraphs of Article 6 Paragraph 1 becomes applicable to the Member.
  • The Member uses the Service in a third nation, other than the Republic of Korea, in violation of the corresponding nation's regulations, causing damage or potential damage to the Company.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553479026768{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
2. In the cases of subparagraphs 1, 2, and 5, of paragraph 1 of this Article, the Company may ask the Member for correction, during appropriate periods, and if the Member still does not take appropriate measures, then the Company may terminate the Service Agreement. 3. In the cases of subparagraphs 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, and 10 of this Article, the Company may immediately terminate the Service Agreement without further notification. 4. When the Company intends to terminate the Service Agreement, the Company shall notify the Member in advance of the reasons and expected date of termination, in writing, email, or any other equivalent means. However, when prior notification is unavailable due to inevitable cases, notification may be provided after the fact. 5. When the Service is terminated, as this Article stipulates, the Member shall be obliged to back up all the resources used, and at termination, all resources assigned to a system shall be returned, with all documents saved in the system deleted.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553479053035{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 32. Suspension of Service Offering
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553479063545{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. The Company may suspend offering of the Service, for any one of the following cases:
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553479091545{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
  • If it is inevitable for the maintenance of the Company;
  • When there is a concern for abnormal service operations, due to state emergencies, faulty service facilities, or congestion of service;
  • When service offering is unavailable due to inevitable reasons for the Company, including natural disasters; and,
  • When telecommunication service is suspended by key telecommunication service providers specified in the Telecommunications Business Act.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553479120636{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
2. In the case of paragraph 1-1 of this Article, the Company must notify the fact in the method registered by the Member and by posting on the service access screen or company website. 3. In the cases of subparagraphs 2, 3, and 4 of paragraph1 of this Article, service may be temporarily suspended without prior notification.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553479458643{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Chapter 7. Damages
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553479467437{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 33. Company’s Damages
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553479480455{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. The Company, if the Member is incurred with damage because the Company provided lower than monthly availability (defined below) due to service interruption attributable to the Company, shall compensate in accordance with the claim of the Member.
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553479503812{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
  • Monthly Availability (%) = 100 * [1-{“Total duration (in minutes) of service interruption due to attributable reasons of the Company during a month of the Service/ one month of use of the Service (in minutes)}]
  • Duration of an interruption shall begin to be measured from the moment when the Member notifies to the Company of the fact that service is unavailable (or, from the moment when the Company acknowledges the fact before the Member notifies).
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553479549825{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
2. Damages in accordance with paragraph 1 of this Article shall be determined upon the criteria in the table below. However, such measurement might be differently applied, if the Company has its own criteria for damage compensation and notifies the Member as part of the operating policy or on the website.
[/vc_column_text][mk_table]
Monthly Availability Damages
Over 99.0% ~ Below 99.9% 10% of the three month-average service price
Over 95.0% ~ Below 99.0% 25% of the three month-average service price
Below 95.0% 50% of the three month-average service price
[/mk_table][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553479640371{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
3. To claim for compensation for damages in accordance with paragraph 1 of this Article, the Member shall apply in writing including the reason, amount of damages and the grounds for calculation, as well as details of service interruption. 4. The amount of damages in accordance with this Article may be used to purchase other services or pay for the monthly charge of the Service. 5. The Company’s responsibility to compensate the Member for the failed use of the Service shall be confined to damages in accordance with paragraph 1, with no further damages to be provided. 6. Regarding the Free Service provided by the Company, the Company shall not be held liable for any damage whatsoever incurred to the Member. This shall not include, however, damage incurred out of intentions or major faults of the Company. 7. In accordance with the Terms, the Company’s responsibility to compensate the Member shall be confined to the amount that the Member provided to the Company.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553479699518{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 34. Member’s Damages
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553479709094{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
The Member, when damage is incurred to the Company due to his own violation of the Terms and notices, shall compensate for any loss or damage to the Company.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553479776628{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
Article 35. Indemnification of Company
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553479784981{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. The Company, when damage is incurred to the Member, due to any one of the following subparagraphs, shall not compensate:
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553479817729{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
  • Interruption occurs in the Service due to malfunctioning devices purchased by the Member;
  • Out of force majeure, such as war, accident, fire, natural disasters, or state emergencies that are equivalent;
  • Out of intentions or faults of the Member;
  • Due to inevitable features of telecommunication services;
  • Service suspension to prevent scale-up of accidents arising out of information system of the Member;

To this end, the Member shall back up posts, information and documents of the Member at a standalone repository, by the needs of the Member. 7. In case the Company is claimed for damages, sued, or objected by a third party other than the Member, due to the Member's illegal acts or violations of the Terms while using the Service, the Member shall take the responsibility to indemnify the Company at his own expense, and if the Company cannot be indemnified, the Member shall compensate for all damages incurred to the Company.

Article 36. Governing Law and Jurisdictions
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553479859753{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]
1. The Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Republic of Korea. 2. Litigations over conflicts between the Company and the Member shall be filed on the basis of the Member's address at the time of filing, or a governing local court if address is unavailable. However, if the address or place of residence is not clear at the time of filing, the governing court shall be decided upon the Civil Procedure Act. 3. For the Member whose address or place of residence is outside of Korea, litigations between the Company and the Member shall be governed by the Seoul District Court, notwithstanding the previous paragraph.
[/vc_column_text][mk_padding_divider size="10"][/vc_column][/mk_page_section][mk_page_section bg_position="left bottom" bg_repeat="no-repeat" enable_3d="true" section_id="1" sidebar="sidebar-1"][vc_column][mk_padding_divider][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1553479875201{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

1. Regarding As part of the conditions to purchase and/or use the Service, Members shall agree to abide by international regulations and export control regimes of each nation, to protect, import, re-import, sanction, and anti-boycott all corresponding data, including international and economic sanction programs of each nation, such as EU Dual Use Export Controls, US Export Administration Regulations, and International Traffic in Arms Regulations. To avoid any misunderstanding, a Member (or the end user) shall take the sole responsibility for the issue of compliance relating to the method chosen by the Member for the Service, including the transfer and handling of the Member information, or the use thereof subjecting the aforementioned end user of the Company. Because all information of the Member uploaded by the Member or the end user may be hosted at servers around the globe, the Member cannot upload information listed on relevant trade restrictions and shall be responsible for preventing the end user from uploading prohibited information. A Member shall confirm and warrant that he or she is not on any restrictions or sanctions lists issued by agencies including without limitation United Nations Security Council, United States National Security Council, and agencies of the US government (e.g. list of specially-designated EU nations by the US government agencies and the list of member states sanctioned overseas by the corresponding nations). 2. If a Member provides services to the customers of the Member using the Service in a third-party nation outside of the Agreed Territory, the member must notify the Company of such transactions in advance. 3. A Member must indemnify the Company for legal liabilities incurred due to the Member’s violation of this Article or failure to comply with regulations in the Agreed Territory or a third-party nation outside of the Agreed Territory.

item.title: 안녕하세요!
item.dc:creator: enflex_en190328
item.content:encoded: 워드프레스에 오신 것을 환영합니다. 이것은 첫번째 글입니다. 이 글을 고치거나 지운 후에 블로깅을 시작하세요!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: 안녕하세요, 이거은 댓글입니다. 댓글의 검토, 편집, 삭제를 시작하려면 관리자 화면의 댓글 화면으로 가세요. 댓글 작성자의 아바타는 그라바타에서 전송됩니다.

item.title: 샘플 페이지
item.dc:creator: enflex_en180411
item.content:encoded:
이것은 예제 페이지입니다. 이것은 한곳을 차지하고 사이트 내비게이션에 표시되기 때문에 블로그 글과는 다릅니다(대부분의 테마). 대다수의 사람들은 잠재적인 사이트 방문자들에게 자신을 소개하기 위한 "사이트 소개" 페이지부터 시작합니다. 다음과 같이 작성할 수 있습니다:
안녕하세요! 저는 낮에는 자전거로 배달하는 일을 하고 밤에는 배우가 되기 위한 연기 연습을 합니다. 여기는 제 웹사이트입니다. 서울에 살고 순돌이라는 이름의 대단한 개가 있으며 피냐 콜라다를 좋아합니다.(비 맞기도 좋아합니다.)
...또는 이럴 수도 있습니다:
가나다 회사는 2012년에 만들어졌으며 그 후로 소비자를 위해 품질 좋은 생산품을 만들고 있습니다. 고양시에 위치하며 2천명의 직원이 있고 고양시 커뮤니티를 위해 다양하고 멋진 일을 하고 있습니다.
새로운 워드프레스 사용자로써, 자신의 관리자 화면으로 가서 이 페이지를 삭제하고 자신의 콘텐츠로 채워진 새로운 페이지를 만들어보세요. 즐기세요!
